text: Does it work when you replace the override with: `{{ require_css(get_public_template_url("../../child.css")) }}`
The child css will be at the end of al your css files so will override the theme css.

Max thanks for the response. I changed it to {{ require_css(get_public_template_url(“../../child-pwr-obo.css”)) }} the name of the child theme CSS still didn’t work. I originally changed it to what it was because the power theme documentation said to.
Best thing you can do is then make a support ticket: <https://www.maka-agency.com/submit-support-ticket|Submit a support ticket here>

Hi there, i have two Themes. The second one is a clone from the first one.
Now i did some changes in the code in Theme 2
It is uploaded in HubSpot and assigned to a landing page. But i cannot see the changes.
Some changes were CSS, some others in the base.html file

Does anyone have an idea, what i can do to see the changes?
Did you use a template from the second theme or are you accidentally using the original?
